results.title: Young Hands
results.creator_credit: W.H. Shepard, John Martin-Jones and John Appleton
results.brief_description:
Essentially an adverisement for the Juniour Farmer’s Organisation, focusing on how members and the community benefit from it. Stars ‘Hal’, a young man who must continue to run his family’s farm while his father is ill.

Follows Hal and other junior farmers members as they complete various ‘projects’ such as raising lambs, preserving fruit and growing crops. Strong social element within the organisation is exemplified by a social dance that is used to bookend Hal’s story.

Very earnest piece. Amusing end scene.

results.title: Melbourne (no. 8)
results.brief_description:
General shots (rushes) of Melbourne ‘life’ from the 50s. All images very iconic and nostalgic.

Section 1. Shot of Yarra, looking towards Anderson St bridge.

Section 2. Royal Melbourne Show. Shots of various farm machinery on display. Crowds of people walking around enjoying themselves. Wood-chopping competition. Ladies riding horses, horse racing. More wood-chopping.
results.description:

results.title: Melbourne (no. 4)
results.brief_description:
General shots (rushes) of Melbourne ‘life’ from the 50s. All images very iconic and nostalgic.

Section 1. Several shots of daffodils in a park. Nice colour, long shots.

Section 2. Shots in a park near the Yarra looking towards the city.

Section 3. Shots of Fitzroy gardens, conservatory and Government House.

Section 4. Shots of large houses in Toorak.

Section 5. ANZAC day march in the city. Many people involved.

results.title: Silent passages
results.brief_description:
Silent Passages is based around photographs taken of the World War 2 tunnels under the Darwin and inspired by the kind of fantasy storytelling used in games such as Riven and Myst. In the words of the artist “We find a man alone at the entrance to a tunnel. He enters. The labyrinth before him, a reminder of a past long gone. Eerie sounds are triggered as he passes from chamber to chamber and nothing appears as it seems. His story is hidden beneath a mask of time and decay.
Silent Passages is a legend within a story. Two parallel journeys fused by a lover, and torn apart by the betrayal of war.” Soundtrack is “Music for Guitar and Shakuhachi” by Andrew MacGregor and Marion Schaap.

results.title: Melbourne (no. 1)
results.brief_description:
General shots (rushes) of Melbourne ‘life’ from the 50s. All images very iconic and nostalgic.

Section 1. Brief shots of the Shrine of Rememberance.

Section 2. Shots of the 1848 building from several angles.

Section 3. A cricket match at the MCG. Sparse crowd. Several angles and shots, lasts for three minutes.

Section 4. Luna Park at night. Brief shot of the entrance and the exterior of a dogem cars attraction.

Section 5. Houses in Melbourne; older and ‘new’. Brief.

Section 6. Various shots of parks and gardens. Brief.

Section 7. Spencer Street rail yards, shot from above. Brief.

Section 8. A few shots of the city, including trams and St. Paul’s cathederal.

Section 9. Woman in a park, admiring a flower bed. Good close-ups.

Section 10. Camera pans up from the Yarra to St Paul’s Cathederal/city in the distance. Nice shot.

Section 11. Good shots of the city from the Yarra.

results.title: Melbourne (no. 2)
results.brief_description:
General shots (rushes) of Melbourne ‘life’ from the 50s. All images very iconic and nostalgic.

Section 1. Football match between Carlton and Richmond at Punt Road oval. Huge crowd. Good shots of football being played and the crowd reacting to the game.

Section 2. Two women at an observation point above the city.

Section 3. Shot of State Library with tram going past, shot of two statues in the city.

Section 4. Shots taken from behind St Paul’s cathederal looking down towards the Yarra, MCG and Flinders St train tracks.

Section 5. Shots of various statues and fountains around Melbourne.

Section 6. Shot from car driving along St Kilda Road, away from the city.

Section 7. Shots of city in the afternoon. Busy scene with Cars, buses, trams and people.

Section 8. Shot looking towards city from bank of Yarra. A man sits on a park bench in the foreground, surrounded by Seagulls.

results.title: The Nature of paradise
results.creator_credit: Lucinda Gamble and Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television
results.brief_description:
Three women - Trish Molloy (artist), Monique La Fontaine (artist), Sharon Wiggan (law student) - tell their stories, each from a personal perspective, of their relationship and connection to the Western Australian north-west coastal town of Broome. Trish and Monique are travellers who have separately found their way to Broome and stayed and Sharon is an Aboriginal Australian who was brought up in Broome, left to study in Perth and who has now returned home to Broome. The documentary explores each woman’s emotional and spiritual attachment to the town, to their surrounding environment and their kinship with the people of Broome and with each other. Evocative and beautifully photographed by Veronica Iacono, and sensitively scripted and directed by Lucinda Gamble, “The Nature of paradise” is stunningly rich in images and colour, of reds and blues, of the earth, sky and the ocean and is accompanied by an ambient musical soundtrack, “Free diving” written and performed by Lorrei
Coffin. Interspersed throughout the documentary are images of both Trish and Monique’s paintings which reflect their transitional journey to this place called “paradise”.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lucinda Gamble and Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television

results.title: Parents of gays
results.creator_credit: Open Channel Productions and Margaret Lacey
results.brief_description: Danny Vadasz interviews parents of gay children who speak quite frankly and openly about their reactions and feelings when they learnt of their children’s homosexuality.

results.title: Access Video 1973-1982
results.creator_credit: Helen Eisler and Open Channel Productions
results.brief_description:
This is a retrospective look at Access Video, an
independent public broadcasting project, using archival
footage shot over a period of nine years Australia wide.The images encapsulate Australian life on a social,
political and cultural level providing a historical glimpse
of the developing community and political activity during
the seventies whilst also illustrating the growth and
maturing of independent video within Australia. NB: Some
footage is of poor quality both in sound and image.

results.title: Cross my heart
results.creator_credit: David Swann, Andrew Wiseman, Open Channel Productions and Jocelyn Moorhouse
results.brief_description: Two women attending a friend’s funeral who died from cancer vow to quit smoking, cold turkey. There are obstacles in their way however, including a sister who has just split up with her partner, her son in tow. They instil a no smoking policy in the house with penalties for those who break the rules. Features salient points about the ill effects of smoking and the side effects you can expect when quitting. Cast includes: Marilyn O’Donnell, Parthena Amanatidis, Tamasin Ramsay, Brian Nankervis.
